# Jira PAT Skill for Claude Code

A Claude Code plugin for managing Jira issues on self-hosted/enterprise instances using Personal Access Tokens (PAT).

## Why This Skill?

This skill is designed for environments where:
- Jira uses SSO/SAML authentication
- Basic Auth (email + API token) doesn't work
- The `jira-cli` tool fails to authenticate

**For Atlassian Cloud users**: Use [clawdbot-jira-skill](https://github.com/openclaw/skills/tree/main/skills/kyjus25/clawdbot-jira-skill) which uses Basic Auth instead.

## Installation

### Via Plugin Marketplace

```bash
/plugin marketplace add dejanb/jira-pat-skill
/plugin install jira-pat-skill
```

### Manual Installation

Clone this repo and copy the `skills/jira-pat` folder to your `.claude/skills/` directory.

## Setup

Set these environment variables:

```bash
export JIRA_PAT="your-personal-access-token"
export JIRA_URL="https://issues.example.com"
```

### Creating a Personal Access Token

1. Go to your Jira profile â†’ Personal Access Tokens
2. Create a new token with appropriate permissions
3. Copy and save it securely

## Features

- Get issue details
- Search with JQL
- Create, update, and transition issues
- Add comments
- List epic children
- Shell helper functions

## Usage

Once installed, Claude Code will automatically use this skill when you ask about Jira operations. Examples:

- "Get the details of PROJ-123"
- "Search for open issues in project PROJ"
- "Close issue PROJ-456 with a comment"
- "List all children of epic PROJ-100"
